name: Pope Sixtus V
summary: Sixtus V, born Felice Peretti, was Pope from 1585 to 1590. He was one of the most important Counter-Reformation popes. He reformed the Roman Curia, established 15 permanent congregations, and fixed the number of cardinals at 70. He completed the dome of St. Peter's Basilica and erected many obelisks and fountains in Rome. He was a strong administrator who restored papal finances and worked to implement the reforms of the Council of Trent. He also revised the Vulgate Bible.
